title: Old Trafford - Wikipedia
snippet: Old Trafford (/ˈtræfərd/) is a football stadium in Old Trafford, Greater Manchester, England, and is the home of Manchester United. With a capacity of 74,197, it is the largest club football stadium (and second-largest football stadium overall after Wembley Stadium) in the United Kingdom, ...

title: Our Guide To Old Trafford – The Home Of Manchester United | Football Ticket Pad
snippet: So without further ado, this is our guide to Old Trafford - the home of Manchester United. Manchester United began as a club named Newton Heath and changed its name in 1902. Before they moved to Old Trafford, they played their football games at North Road and Bank Street in Clayton.
